subject: Fwd: Re: [junit] Re: How to test private member variables?
msgSnippet: ... The unexpected birth of six bunnies last night made it impossible for me to do this last night. I ll try again today. :) Two litters of rabbits in three
messageBody:
*********** BEGIN FORWARDED MESSAGE ***********
>>Sorry I have some difficult to understand your great suggestions due
>>to my new to Junit. So far, I know that I need separate the command
>>line parsing into two steps. First is to transfer command line args
>>to a builder. Second is to use the builder to set the private member
>>variables. I could understand the first step to use equivalent
>>operation to compare two builder class objects. However, I have some
>>sort of difficult to understand the Second step. Could you provide
>>some code snippets to give more concrete explanations? Thanks very
>>much!
>
>I will take some time to write this up on my JUnit blog tonight.
>http://junit.blog-city.com

The unexpected birth of six bunnies last night made it impossible for me to do this last night. I'll try again today. :)

Two litters of rabbits in three weeks. Anyone want a bunny?


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
